Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Cybopache on March 08, 2006, 16:51:37
hehe you getting old mate !
ITs  alzheimer light dude.

Well its Ewido you mean? I have it up and running , but don`t take this bi... I have also a pop up program running in the back ground and on the most agressive sets, but this f.... does come again and again.

Othér things to report.......... ::)

hehe I`ve solved my problem with PunkBuster.I got support from PunkBuster,I had to run a program.Explained as follow:If other do run into it :

Note #2: Make sure you run the game under an Administrator or equivalent account under Windows. Make sure a password is set on this Windows account. If you do have access an admin account, you can right click on the application you want to run and select "Run As". This will allow you to give admin access to that program and should allow you to play with a limited user.

When that did not work, please try this file:

http://www.greyknight17.com/spy/VX2Finder(126).exe


Click the "Find VX2.betterinternet info" button to make sure that you don't HAVE this adware. If there are no files listed, go on to the last step.

If you find the virus, (it is usually 3 random named dll files)

Select all the files found.
Press 'Delete These Files'.

The program will delete all files but one that will be deleted on reboot.
Allow program to reboot.

Once Restarted:
Press 'Guardian.reg'.
Press 'User Agent'.
Click on the "Restore Policy" Button!

Clicking on "find vx2.BetterInternet info" again should show all fields blank (especially "User Agent String"). When you still get the Inadequate O/S priviledges kick, make a new note in your ticket and include the scan results from VX2Finder(126).exe in your note.


Cheers cybo commander

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on March 13, 2006, 15:59:34
My first Time

The first time ever I thought I wouldnt chicken out and use a gun, but would use my knife on a guy. It was a sniper on Sharqi Paninsular, below the top of the 3 MEC bases. Not too far from the first american base actually, on some hills around the back (the best place for your first time ;)). He was a sniper, I was a beginner, hardly any idea how to do what I knew was required.

Well, I whipped it out, and walked up behind him, and he had been lying down shooting off. As I approached, he got up and walked off. So I chased, trying to slash from behind and getting nowhere. 8-odd slashes in thin air later, and almost having run in front of him in a bid to catch up, I finally struck from behind, scap style. Well, the git survived, and got down again, thinking he had been seen.

Finally ! A sitting target, wham, back of the head, and one dead sniper ! And one happy Erjin !

Though I prefer guns :)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: sp1cy on March 14, 2006, 09:14:57
 there is somthing i dont understand about the helicopter maybe gun can tell us since he say his good at it.....its about shooting the pilot missels..those missels are supposed to be air to ground
 missels but somehaw i cant aim them down unless i pitch down the front of the plane which will make it move forward in unwanted speedy move....or the other way which i saw players doing it is to decend to ground level to have a direct shot...which is not very realstic a heli pilot should be able to stand still at high  and aim those missles downward without having to pitch the front of the plane or to make a dive attack...am i missing somthing?

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Gunwounds on March 14, 2006, 09:22:03
you have to do a dive attack.. you can decreasse this speed of your dive tho by making sure you are stationary before diving.  You dont want to dive if you are already going full speed (300mph) in a chopper.  SLow the chopper down... acquire target and slowly dive and fire.

Also the missiles are great for shooting enemy helicopters in teh air.  So they are air to ground and air to air missiles as well.


In addition... the missiles fire slightly below the targeting reticle...so put the oject below the reticle for accuracy.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Acriku- on March 14, 2006, 11:52:49
I've been commander for a decent amount of time, and I'd have to say that it is fun. I usually end up being engineer/commander because nobody takes their time to repair your stuff, so I end up doing it anyway and also my commander stuff. It's stressful though when you mark a place for artillery and your guys are attracted to that very spot all at once like a magnet. I try to yell over the team chat, but nobody listens (I've been warning them in advance, which seems to work most of the time). Often times I'll find myself going at odds with the other commander over side bases (like in ghost town) where extra artillery is found. You get double points if you win the match, too  ;D

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on March 15, 2006, 08:32:58
Quote from: Gunwounds on March 14, 2006, 07:19:55
yea soldier of fortune 2 lets you throw the knives.  Probably the only thing BF2 is missing.. but then again BF2 has tons more stuff that SF2 doesnt have.

Another thing I would like to see is the gore realism that SOF had. I remember in that game, things like when a guy was shot say in the foot, he would start hopping around and yelling for a bit holding his foot. Or hit in the arm and he would hold it and scream. I know it would really mess up the rating BF2 has already, but damn that would add to the realism alot I think. It wasen't so much all the blood, but rather the real responses to being shot anywhere on the body. Anyone who has ever played Soldier of Fortune knows what I mean.  ;)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

Hey everyone, thanks to ergin, I can now play bf 2 on his comp when ever I'm allowed heh. I am now a coperal with and have a new unlock but havn't decided which gun to get yet so I'm real exited ;D
I already have the PKM which really is a fabulous gun, kind of feels like a lighter version of the apc gun turret as it fires the same slow rate as the apc IMO. Its a slow heavy gun which packs a punch from short and medium range and I killed 7 ppl with it in the prone position and thas to show how good it is unlike these guns which only have 30 bullets or less, considering 100 bullets in one gun and that helps to know I can happily mow down anyone without worrying for ammo.

So I just wanna say a big thankyou to ergin for letting me use his comp for a great game of bf 2.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on March 16, 2006, 06:11:03
Quote from: Madenod on March 16, 2006, 04:23:10
p.s. scar. that time I played in the server we were in. I had to log out coz I had to do something, and I couldn't come back to that server cos I lost the ip for it. In case u where wondering heh. 8)

No biggie. I was playing Commander that game anyway. On the unlock, I'm not gonna tell you what or which to go with, but I will say that the Spec-Ops unlock is very nice..the g36c. In my opinion anyway it's just a damn nice all around weapon, in semi or auto  mode with a nice fast rate of fire.

I've taken out snipers with it at long ranges also. All the G36-series guns kick ass I think anyway. Very low recoil,accurate,light (except the G3 assault). I have them all except the next G36-Support unlock.

Btw. Yesterday I picked up a dead guys kit to see what it was and it happened to be the new AT-kit French made weapon.  What a piece of crap!! took like 15 hits to a guy to actually kill him. I'm not trying to bash France here in anyway, but in a game about modern warfare...I just have issues I guess about unlocking a "French-made weapon." :P  Now that i've actually tried it out some..I am totally correct....it kinda blows (the weapon that is).

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: sp1cy on March 24, 2006, 06:27:48
 
 olso i have some question which i dont recall them all but i will post as i remeber them..

 do u guys use joysticks with planes?? haw come jets get to roll so fast while i need scroll the
 slow mouse all over the table to get a single turn....
 
 olso it say in vhicels  controls that left shift i used to make a boost..is that true i didnt notice mutch difffrece boosting a tank for ex.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: gunner154 on March 24, 2006, 07:45:43
Only jets can get the left shift boost (or just double-tap 'W', or whatever your forward key is). It's the same as running. Other vehicles do not get this function.

I don't fly jets often. Hell, I get pwned by Easy computer on Operation Clean Sweep, can't fly those awesome things for nuts... maybe I'll switch to using the keyboard. Not everybody uses a joystick, or owns one anyway. For the mouse, you can adjust the sensitivity, Yaw and Pitch factors for aircraft under Controls. Increase them.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on March 24, 2006, 07:50:50
I have Yaw and pitch at max, and for planes I think sensitivity is like 3+...

Its helps a lot !

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

well I use a joystick for jets, and the rolling thingy is pretty easy, you just push your joystick either to the right or to the left. I also have the option to twist the handle  to get the rudder right or left.I mean if you really want to get good at flying " JOYSTICK" is the only thing.

It`s right that only jets have the afterburner. Left shift in a tank tower makes you duck in the tower etc. Well anyone can retrieve their account from another Machine,without giving the cd-key away.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on March 25, 2006, 05:54:24
Quote from: sp1cy on March 24, 2006, 06:22:58

 would you be kind enough to tell us what gear are you using?  i usually use the m-95 for short distance blast... when i comes to taking high positions i use the L96-A1  to make max damage..
 hum,,,, the m24!!  i never use it.. :(

I use the M95 mainly when I play sniper, but since the accuracy of sniper rifles have been adjusted now, I prefer to use the MEC or China sniper rifles (semi-autos) personally, I don't really care too much for the M95. For one it's super loud, the crosshairs are way to thick for long range shots to the head, and a long reload time.

I want the new sniper rifle just for those reasons, I've already tried it out a few times and it is perfect...no not damage wise I mean it is silenced, the crosshairs are very very thin, nicer reload time and accurate as hell. Also spicy if your gonna play sniper always use your Claymores always. I would say 1/3 of all my kills as sniper are from Claymores.  Also never stay in one spot, like sit in a treeline for more than a few minutes at one time, troops may not see you but 1 scan from the commander UAV can.


Here is the best way to play as sniper....BE IN A SQUAD for starters get were your gonna snipe, have a support guy with you or near you for ammo(cause snipers run out very fast) and a medic. thats the perfect setup I think anyway. Claymore your flanks,or the top of a ladder of a building if your on one.

If you want to get really good at sniping, always try for headshots as in 1 shot kills. If you can get pretty good at killing with one headshot then you can hit almost anything and kill it.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: sp1cy on April 03, 2006, 08:14:46

 well its all about the range issue.. if you plan to run for long distance and fight close range attacks the pkm will slow you down as it is about 16 kilos to carry and its usless to shot from it unless ure prone... the mg36 gives you the advantage of using it from standing or running status giving you a massive fire power over the ather attacking untis sutch as assolts and SO  units who carry a normal 20 shot magazine rifels..but they will still be faster than you and have more accurecy unless you have better or higher spotes on them whitch is what a good support soldier must do..then you can prone offcorse and have better aim..
 but if you didnt and you had to move long distances or fight hand to hand combat then the pkm is totaly unusfull and you might find the mg more handy and eazy to use like a normal m16 or clachinckof....
the pkm is good if you plan to block a streat or make an anbush to defend a flag it is 10 times more powerfull than the MG-36  but i hurd they reduced it accurecy in one of the patches.. i remeber killing 10 guyes in a row with a pkm  when they tryed to march to a flag just one after the other it a stationary killing machine.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: rigel6669 on April 05, 2006, 20:42:52
Quote from: sp1cy on April 05, 2006, 09:56:10
would u give us some details ef addon? like do we get more unlocks??

All weapons can be found here  http://wiki.bf2s.com/weapons

The L96A1 sniper rifle is the only weapon that can be unlocked from Euro Force
http://wiki.bf2s.com/weapons/unlocks/l96a1
Once you have unlocked the L96A1 you will be able to use it on all bf2 maps

If you have BF2 special forces and/or euroforce it will give you 1 extra unlock/rank
I got both and at my current rank i have 12 unlocks ( did not enable the last 2 yet )

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: gunner154 on April 08, 2006, 02:06:51
It's quite sad that you buy something solely for the unlocks or the new weapons. What's really worth the price tag is the new elements of gameplay that have been added to the game. Special Forces and Euro Force provide that (I don't have EF, but judging SF, the style of the new maps really changes the mode of gameplay altogether. More infantry battles means more fun). The new guns are really just a bonus.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on April 11, 2006, 05:10:52

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Acriku- on April 15, 2006, 22:20:17
Basecamp is basically (to my knowledge) camping in or just outside a base and killing people as they are seen within the base. Baseraping is basically going through a base and killing people as soon as they spawn. When one side is down to their home base, it is generally regarded as fair play when the enemy does not camp that base and instead lets the losing side come to their flags and engage them their (it's more fun for both sides).

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on April 16, 2006, 10:47:21

Claymore the ladder at the top and just sit there taking them out when they spawned. I gained nothing by doing it but it was good sniper practice.  ;)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Acriku- on April 27, 2006, 17:44:59
Quote from: Re-erjin999 on April 25, 2006, 08:57:26

Now I wanna stalk this guy and get him teamkilled, atry the guy, whatever !

By the way, his nick was battleking999 (no relation to Erjin999 ;)).
A funny story happened to me, while being a passenger in a jet (not usually a useful position if you don't mind 1,000 death assists). I was co-piloting and the guy went vertical for a bit and I thought hey this is cool... and then we kept going. And going. And then I realized there wasn't a "we" after all - he bailed long ago! So here I was going vertical in the co-pilot seat, and I think to myself: I wonder how long I can parachute down if I keep going up this high. So, after a moment or two of climbing I bail out and parachute all the way, had to have been around a minute or two. I admired all the visuals as I went down, and lo and behold I got a ribbon I never knew existed! The air time ribbon! I laughed my ass off for a while after that one.

I wish I SSed the guy talking to me as I went down, but when he spoke halfway through my airtime he said "Still falling?" Of course I said "yuuuup". Good times.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Cybopache on April 28, 2006, 16:16:59
air  ribbon is  like 10 sec. in parachute,Spice if you read the guides prob you find youre answer.There are two kind of modes  in the hud .One is for  bombing(the one with half circle in the bottom ) and rockets(´the one with cirkles).for bombs keep the target under the circle in bottom and come in steep.Learn  the tricks in the guides to expand youre experience.
 

Cybo

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on May 06, 2006, 08:29:05
I think if you get Battlefield 2 v1.22 (372MB) you should be set.
Also the Euro-Forces booster pack is nice I think anyway it has some nice roomy maps all daytime geared towards tanks,sniping and vehicles,heles and jets. It's not like special forces were the game has to start over when you choose a server. Also, those maps are great for commanding thats how I got my veteran commander badge. I would say that for the 10 bucks you get way more gameplays on the euro force maps than the special forces by far. In fact, I would have never gotten special forces for the fact that I just never play it now.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on May 23, 2006, 16:12:31
New patch vers.1.3 just released............


Battlefield 2 v1.3

Hi Everyone,

Patch 1.3 has now been released and is available for immediate download. The release of this patch is in line with our ongoing effort to make the game as enjoyable as possible, releasing quicker fixes addressing some of the things that you want to see changed.

New Features:

    * Co-op: Players can now enjoy single player levels on Internet and LAN play with both Bots and human players. We have added a few options to allow the server admin to modify how the bots behave in game. Co-op play is not permitted on ranked servers.
    * Air Dropped Vehicles: Squad members can no send a request to commanders to drop vehicles at their location.

Bug Fixes & Gameplay Tweaks:

    * Ban list will no longer be wiped in the event of a server crash.
    * Abandoned helicopters will no longer remain in flight.
    * If a player joins a squad while dead they will not be permitted to use the squad leader as a spawn point until they have spawned at a flag once.
    * Flag Capture bar will now react accurately to players entering the capture radius.
    * Friendly vehicles will no longer appear as valid targets for missile systems. The box with the X through it will still appear however the locked tone will not sound and missiles fired will not track the friendly target.
    * Fixed the crash that sometimes occurred when switching between game types.
    * Fixed a tech hang when creating a single player account from an offline account.
    * Fixed Issues with remote console and Linux servers.
    * Fixed the issue that prevented players from ranking up in-game when playing on their regular server.
    * Fixed the bug that altered mini map behavior.
    * Fixed issue with Special Forces rank names.
    * Fixed repairing HUD for the engineer when in a vehicle.

bf2patch1.3.exe - 438MB
bf2incrementalpatch1.22-1.3.exe - 83MB
bf2_server_1.3.exe - 297MB
server files for Linux v1.3 - 297MB

The team at Dice and EA

Here's the patch download links....

http://largedownloads.ea.com/pub/patches/BF2/BF2_Full_13.exe
http://largedownloads.ea.com/pub/patches/BF2/BF2_Incremental_122_13.exe

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: rigel6669 on May 27, 2006, 02:12:49
Community Update - 5/09/06

Greetings Soldiers:

We at DICE and EA are aware of the concern surrounding the coming change to squad selection. We would like to take a moment to ease the feelings of tension related to this change.

Our goal is to refocus game play on team work, squad coordination and to also remove the spawning exploit used by some. In BF2 we introduced tools that would allow players to support one another as they battle for control points. To further enhance this aspect of game play squads were introduced to give players even more tools to coordinate their efforts and support each other.

Allowing squad mates to spawn on the squad leader was intended to provide an easy way for squads to stay together during chaotic battles. Unfortunately squad leaders have been used by some to launch team wide attacks on remote parts of maps with little thought to actual team unity beyond these maneuvers.

We believe this change will refocus the game play on team work and add more value to the roles of Squad Lead and Commander.

/The team at Dice and EA
 

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: gunner154 on May 27, 2006, 05:49:38

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: rigel6669 on June 11, 2006, 03:39:49
Quote from: sp1cy on June 09, 2006, 10:37:35
how many unlocks does it add to the original game?
No new weapons or additional unlocks, just 3 new maps and new vehicles


According to BF2.se, the next Battlefield 2 patch will include a brand new map, Road to Jalalabad. Although not much is currently known about this, it appears that the map will pitch US forces against MEC.
Additionally, the update will include a new game mode known as "infantry only", something that the competitive scene has been asking for since the release of Battlefield 2.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Rewired on June 18, 2006, 05:26:37
Quote from: sp1cy on June 17, 2006, 21:12:27
if you walk 5 miles and i walk 10 kilometers it dosnt mean that i walked longer...
Actually it does mean you walked longer, 5 miles are 8.04672 kilometers, therefore that was a horrible analogy.

Take the case in point, you are a master sergeant, Scar is a master sergeant, he has 10,000 total kills, you, on the other hand, have 2000 kills. See any discrepancies there? Oh, right, the skill level, they obviously compensate for that; so how about this, you are a master sergeant, Scar is a master sergeant, you have played on ABR for 140 hours, Scar has played on EA's "inferior" system for 543 hours. Therefore, in light of these strange statistics which don't seem to add up, wouldn't you have to agree that in ABR it is much easier to gain ranks?

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on July 13, 2006, 05:04:55
Whatever, lets leave that conversation. Hey, lets talk about stats again !

I am going up in what I consider the most important count of sucess at this game. Yes, the old Kill/death ratio.

I was mid 20s when I first looked. Got it up to 50% when I started playing ok. Left the game for a while, and came back, still around the 50% mark.

Note, the longer you play, the more effort it takes to make a significant change.

I now have it up to around 78%.

My aim is to get to 100% and beyond !

My accuracy has suffered in my attempt to get to 100% K/D ratio, probably cos I am shooting like crazy trying to hit where I am not sure there even is anyone.

I am also about 400points away from a promo, and am not sure what to go for. Remember I have normal BF2 (no expansions) so my choice is limited. God I would love to get the F2000, I think I love that gun ! Hardly used it, but when I have, I have liked what I saw.

Also, with scars advice, I have used sniper claymores to get some cheap kills (I consider them cheap :)).

How are you guys doing with K/D ratio and accuracy ? What else do you guys consider important in stats ?

Why has no one mentioned the Glitch ! Beware the Glitch, where players use the vehicle drop (which is only somewhat useful anyway) to enter buildings (drive off the top of a biulding in an alleyway and the front of the vehicle will take you INTO a closed building). You can then shoot out and no one can shoot in. Most used in the hotel on Karkand from what I  have seen.

Its pure evil and EA better rush out a patch for it. Admins do kick for it but how can they always spot it ?

Again, its pure evil.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on July 31, 2006, 19:57:43
I came across this site which has many BF2 tweaks for sytem enhancements. Give it a try on some of them and see what improvments or not may come about.

Info: How can I get better performance out of BF2? 
   


 
 
  Submited: 06-22-06 | Last Update: 1 Week Ago #1   
 

I relize there is another guide out there for BF2, but it only covers graphics settings, so I'll give you some actual "tweaks".

Make sure your ports are open
BF2 is set up to use upnp (universal plug and play), but some firewalls/routers won't open all of the ports the program needs to function. The full list of ports follows:

PHP Code:
TCP 16567
TCP 16569
UDP 27900
UDP/TCP 29900
TCP 80
TCP 4711
TCP 29901
UDP 1500-4999
UDP/TCP 1024-1124
UDP 28910
UDP 16567
UDP 55123-55125 



Change PB Scan Time

One reason why you might be getting spurts of decreased performance while online is PunkBuster scanning your harddrive for cheats/hacks/ect. By default, PB scans every 20 seconds, which can slow you down quite a bit.

To fix this, we'll change the interval between scans from 20 seconds to 50 seconds. This is not detected as hack by PB, and is fully legal on any ranked server. In fact, EvenBalence sanctions it.

Step 1: Open BF2, and join any ranked server that is running PB. (Thats most of them.)
Step 2: Walk around for a bit, then hit the ~ key. (Below "Esc") This opens up the console.
Step 3: Make sure the cursor in the console is blinking, and then type, without quotes, "pb_sleep500". Hit Enter.
Step 4: Without closing the console, type "pb_writecfg" to save the change.

Your lag spikes should be much less frequent, if happening at all.

Rename BF2.exe
Although although nobody knows why this fix improves the gameplay , but I belive is probably that Ati and Nvidia recognise BF2.exe as a game, so by renaming the file, you turn the game into a normal program, not the memory-hogging beast we know it as. Most people see some jump in performance after doing this.

Step 1: The first thing you do is find your game directory, the default is C:\Program Files\EA Games\Battlefield 2 .
Step 2: Find BF2.exe, and right-click on it. Select "Properties".
Step 3: Now rename it to anything you like, but keep it simple so you can revert back later if need be.
Step 4: Before you tell me it dosn't work, change the shortcut on your desktop to reflect the new name. ;)

Run BF2 as a High-Priority application
Step 1: Go back to the BF2 folder.
Step 2: Right click anywhere in the folder and click "New" then "Text Document".
Step 3: Right click on the newly created file and rename it to bf2.bat, The file should then turn into a little cog. If it doesn't, you will need to uncheck the "Hide extensions for known file types" option in Tools>Folder Options>View.
Step 4: Edit your new BAT file, and paste in:

PHP Code:
@echo off 
cd /d "C:\Program Files\EA GAMES\Battlefield 2" 
start /high BF2.exe +menu 1 +fullscreen 1 

Then save, but if you edied your BF2.exe's name in the last tweak, reflect that change here. Also, direct your Desktop shortcuts to the BAT file.

Manualy update PunkBuster
Punkbuster, the anti-cheat/anti-hack tool in many games, including BF2, is suposed to auto-update itself, but it rarley does, and old PB files can cause frequent connection errors in online play. You can manualy update PB with the application here: http://www.evenbalance.com/index.php...upport-bf2.php

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on August 19, 2006, 09:14:09
Hopefully pacth 1.4 will fix the exploit/Hotel glitch.

Here is what I have found so far about patch 1.4.2  + 1.4 (both to be released as 1.4).

Remember its still in beta, although I read in spain that it was meant to be released on the 15th of August (gone now). No mention of this specific exploit  >:(.

================================================================================
Battlefield 2: V1.4.2
ReadMe File
July 14, 2006
================================================================================
Road to Jalalabad

- Tickets adjustements
- Removal of 1 US tank to help address balance issues.

No Vehicles Option

- Added a new Server Browser Filter option for No Vehicles
- Return Health to default BF2 level
- Return Medic pack and Revive values to Default BF2
- Default spawn times to Default BF2 setting.
- No Vehicles is now a ranked server option!

We kept:

- Keep the current sprint bar setting (I.e. 2x sprint)
- Keep the current Vehicle exclusion list (i.e. we are not introducing light jeeps etc, just keeping the boats on Carrier levels).


================================================================================
Battlefield 2: V1.4
ReadMe File
June 30, 2006
================================================================================
================================================================================
Patch v1.4
================================================================================
GAMEPLAY TWEAKS
- The vehicle drop has been modified to help prevent exploits such as blocking enemy vehicles, destroying vehicles and commander assets, or as an alternative to artillery.
- C4 tossing distance has been reduced.
- A prone->crouch delay has been added.

BUG FIXES

- Fixed the Linux server hangs when trying to load a Special Forces Co-Op map.
- Another attempt at fixing the Red/Blue nametag bug.
- Fixed the missing server info on the map briefing screen.
- Fixed the server browser issues with updating info.
- Fixed the filter by maps size option in the server browser.
- Fixed a low reproducibility crash bug related to the vehicle drop.
- Fixed a crash in Co-op after a player is revived without a kit.
- Fixed a server crash on Linux 32 when trying to rotate maps in Coop Mode.
- Fixed the occasionnal red distance marker appearing on the ground.
- Fixed the bug that caused the player's arms to become invisible when switching weapons.
- Co-Op bot console commands now function on local servers.
- Fixed the excessive damage taken by the Muscle Car.
- Adjusted the minimum number of players to start the round on ranked servers.
- Re-enabled unlocks on unranked servers.
- Commander options are no longer available whilst commander is dead.
- Fixed bug where a spawn point is shown as selected when it is not if player has spawned in during the preview round.
- Co-Op (Local Server) - Fixed the issue where no other players may join the server if the server host is kicked and banned.
- Ranked Servers now force unlocks.
- Added support for multiple gamemodes in single maplist for mods

Any ideas?

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on August 20, 2006, 03:30:06
Not sure, but you can use "renderer.drawFPS 1" in the ingame console (end key, next to home). Then you can see the FPS as you try different setts.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on August 20, 2006, 07:01:01
Try from very lowest settings on everything first. Sound Card plays a huge role also. Does it lag when you get showered with artillery? or just lagging on everything? I'm running it on a 3000+ and 5500 still with no lag on low sets 800x600 70hrz...unless i'm on a crappy server with a 250 ping.

Although, with a 5500 256 mg. I don't even attempt to go any higher on graphics than low,that's just how graphic card heavy the game is.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: GhostHunter on August 20, 2006, 09:12:53
I don't know why it doesn't show up on dxdiag, but the card is actually a Soundblaster Live! 5.1 Digital, so it's not a half bad card (not the half best, either).

Airstrikes and artillery equals immense lag. The worse though is when you go into the near-death/explosion mode and it goes blurry.

But besides that, the gameplay is choppy at best. I'm going to XP Pro x64-bit in a few days, and looking at prices I'm actually going for the 512MB GeForce 7800 because the 7900 is still too expensive for me to buy and throw out for a dx10 card come January.

But I just don't know how it can be *this* bad..

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Rewired on August 20, 2006, 12:57:29
Ghost, unfortunately a 6100 is really just a word-processor card, in this instance it might even be better to have scar's 5500FX. Anything below a 6600 is not going to cut it for new games these days, however if you are looking for a new card and plan to upgrade as soon as possible to DX10 I would recommend getting a 7600gt because as of now that's the card where you will get the most bang for your buck, and it can play all the latest games at maximum or near maximum settings to boot.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Gunwounds on August 24, 2006, 02:42:05
2142 may turn out to be nice.

But I would recommend  QUAKE: Enemy Territory instead.

Why?

Because BF 2142 is just gonna be more of the same old same old, with some tweaks of course.  Basically a re-skinned BF2 with some new features.

But QUAKE: Enemy Territory is going to be revolutionary in gameplay, mechanics, and graphics.

For instance, Humans will have medics that can revive.  But the Alien enemy will have medics who cant revive but can assimilate corpses of humans into spawn points for dead comrades. 

Another cool feature is that vehicles will be designed realistically.  So if you shoot the back wheel off of a 4-wheeler it will just go around in circles and be useless.

Humans will have chooper-like aircraft with constant speed and maneuverability that we are used to.  Aliens will have anti-grav choppers that are more maneuverable at low altitudes but slow and less maneuverable at high altitudes. 


But probably the most important feature of all is the sequential capping system.   No more BS of having someone fly a plane over enemy lines, parachute out, and take a cap point solo.  No more having spread out fights all over the map with 2-3 people in each fight.

Now you will have both armies clashing at the same cap point. (just like in Valve's TFC, oh the memories)   You will still be able to go behind enemy lines and disrupt supplies or spawning .... but no more cheap ass one man capping behind lines. 


The map wont be linear but the capping system will be.  You will start at your HQ and start taking cap points closest to you as you enemy will do the same.  You should meet somewhere in the center and the epic clashes that we lack in BF2 will finally exist.  To be honest i am getting tired of 10 different conflicts spread over a map with 2-3 persons in each conflict in BF2. I wanna see all the tanks and all the planes and all the troops duke it out for the finale.  Cant wait.   

Oh but thats just my humble opinion on basic facts that are known about the game from an interview with John Carmack the developer.  If you are a google-slave with subnormal intelligence who cant think for himself and has no idea what it is he is looking for in a game, you may need to wait for a paid reviewer to first play the game for 2 hours, and then assign it a percentile score before you consider buying it. 





AC

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

I agree with the statement that BF, either 2 or 4215 (or what ever number it is, I cant be bothered to scroll to check !) will be pretty similar, which isnt necessarily a bad thing, a new angle on a recipe that works might be good for EA and some players, but I already have BF2, I dont go around playing lots of games, I prefer to enjoy a few good ones I find.

I disagree that there are no epic battles in BF2. I think there can be and at times there arent. They are not forced and they are not always garuanteed, but they do occur, especially when the maps split like on Karkand where the mec are pushed back tot he bridge and snipers and medics have a field day.

Perhaps have a more forced face on huge battle will be fun, but personally I prefer it as it is with BF2. Maybe I know no better, but then ignorance is bliss :P.

Basically the big battles depends on players and commanders mindsets.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Gunwounds on August 24, 2006, 13:09:24
Quote from: Re-erjin999 on August 24, 2006, 08:43:45

I disagree that there are no epic battles in BF2. I think there can be and at times there arent. They are not forced and they are not always garuanteed, but they do occur, especially when the maps split like on Karkand where the mec are pushed back tot he bridge and snipers and medics have a field day.

Perhaps have a more forced face on huge battle will be fun, but personally I prefer it as it is with BF2. Maybe I know no better, but then ignorance is bliss :P.

Basically the big battles depends on players and commanders mindsets.

well yea big battles happen..... BUT the bridge at karkand is probably the best chokepoint BF2 has to offer ... and yet i dont really consider sniping and reviving to be all that epic.  Sure you do get big fights in the middle of the map sometimes... but that is often dissolved by the cheap one-man capping in a dune buggy.

Many times as a commander i have seen it happening on the satellite.  I will see the two main forces clash and i will think... oh this is great.  But on my satellite scan i will see that one prick who drove solo in a buggy or van to some cap point 60 miles behind the main fight and cap it.  Then all of a sudden the big clash going on dissolves and everyone scatters across the entire map in a frenzy of Flag capping.  Its like the flag-capping version of "whack-a-mole".

It gets to the point sometimes where people are more interested in running around capping flags in buggies and choopers (like headless chickens) than they are at really fighting.

In QUAKE: Enemy territory  i think perhaps the forced face-offs will encourage more actual "fighting" than just trying to swipe a flag.  Perhaps this will limit freedom a bit, as in BF2 you have the freedom to drive your buggy up the side of a mountain and fire your sniper rifle at the sun for 10 minutes and not have it really affect the outcome of the battle.   Whereas with Quake: Enemy Territory, if you arent on the front lines with the rest of your mates you'll eventually be camped in your HQ sucking down 50cal. of cold hard lead.


AC

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Acriku- on August 24, 2006, 19:55:35
If they had "slayer" type games or "team killing" matches in BF2, then I'd agree with you. But if the point of the game, at least to win, is to cap flags, then how can you complain?

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Gunwounds on August 24, 2006, 20:32:33
Quote from: Acriku- on August 24, 2006, 19:55:35
If they had "slayer" type games or "team killing" matches in BF2, then I'd agree with you. But if the point of the game, at least to win, is to cap flags, then how can you complain?

Actually you can win by killing off all the enemy tickets by simply killing them. When it says 300  vs 300, each ticket represents a human life.  So if you kill 50 of them they go down to 250. SO there are two ways to win.  And i'm not complaining about flag capping.... just that when teamwork and combat are forsaken for cheap flag swipes.  Plus when someone caps a flag waaaaay behind enemy teritory... it makes everyone panic and they start scattering about.

Sure its fun for the guy who does the behind the line capping (yea i've done it), but its detrimental to the game in that it dilutes bigger conflicts into smaller firefights.  Which is why i sorta like it when we have the enemy trapped at their uncappable HQ, because then its a forced face off.

That doesnt mean ther eis a right way or wrong way to enjoy battle FPS games.  I'm just saying i hope Enemy Territory delivers something i have been waiting 6 years for.  Last time i played a game that forced epic face offs was Team Fortress Classic from Valve back in 2000.  (Was packaged with Half Life 1)

If you arent familiar with TFC, try this link  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Team_Fortress_Classic

It was the first great team based battle FPS game.  God how i miss it.  Looking back at the graphics now makes me chuckle.  There was supposed to be a TFC2 but it was delayed until HL2 engine came out and people still dont know if it will be made.




Man how i miss Dustbowl map with those gates that would raise up hehe.  I also miss the spy class.  Wish BF2 had something like that.  Was fun infiltrating enemy base disguised as one of them and then stabbing flag-guard in the back
(http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/7/7e/Spyboth.PNG)Spy
 
The Spy (new model left, old model right)The stealth assassin of TFC, this class has fairly light armor and average speed, but has the unique ability to disguise himself as a member of an opposing team. His "special skill" button brings up the disguise menu, letting the player choose what team and what class he would like to appear to be. Enemy sentry guns will not fire on a Spy disguised as a member of that team, making them very capable of penetrating a base's defense. A disguised Spy can also position himself behind an unwary enemy to deliver an instant-kill stab (in the back of the head) with his knife. Attacking with the knife or firing any weapon causes the Spy to lose his disguise, but tossing grenades does not, making Spies ultimate sentry gun killers. The Spy can also feign death, letting him bide his time as a corpse while he changes disguise and plans his next move. Geared more for offensive support, the Spy is one of the most challenging classes to play effectively, but a skilled Spy can be very disruptive against the enemy team. Even suspicion of a Spy in the enemy team's midst can create a gaping hole in an organized defense, as defenders waste ammo shooting each other for "Spy checks" (enemy Spies still visibly bleed if damaged) or are lured out of position. However, this class lacks the speed, armor, and weaponry to hold in a straight-up shootout against most other classes, and any contact with an opposing team's Scout or Spy will expose him.

Another potent weapon available only to this class is the gas grenade, which has a temporary hallucinatory effect, causing enemies to see and hear phantom explosions, shots, flames and tossed grenades for a short period of time. This relatively harmless effect masks the fairly moderate damage over time the grenade causes while an enemy is in its area of effect. In large doses, Spy gas (or Fairy Dust) can cause severe damage.

Rounding out the Spy's unique arsenal is the tranquilizer pistol, which fires a special dart that does negligible damage, but greatly reduces its target's rate of movement temporarily. It's best used on faster classes to facilitate a lethal knife strike. The Spy is also armed with the double-barreled shotgun, nail gun, and up to 4 normal grenades.




AC

For instance,


Dragon Weapon System


Primary function: Anti-armor weapon system
ManBuilder: McDonnell Douglas Aerospace and Missile Systems and Raytheon
Length:
Launcher: 45.4 inches (115.32 cm)
Missile: 33.3 inches (84.58 centimeters)
Weight:
Ready to Fire: 33.9 lbs (Day Tracker)
48.7 lbs (Night Tracker)
Day Tracker (Sights): 6.75 lbs
Thermal Night Tracker (w/1 bottle and battery): 21.65 lbs
Maximum effective range: 3281 feet (1000 meters)
Time of flight: 11.2 seconds
Armor penetration: Will defeat T-55, T-62, or T-72 w/o added armor
Unit Replacement Cost:
Night Tracker System: $51,000
Day Tracker System: $13,000

Mission: Primary: To engage and destroy armor and light armored vehicles. Secondary: defeat hard targets such as bunkers and field fortifications.

Features: The warhead power of Dragon makes it possible for a single Marine to defeat armored vehicles, fortified bunkers, concrete gun emplacements, or other hard targets. The launcher consists of a smoothbore fiberglass tube, breech/gas generator, tracker and support, bipod, battery, sling, and forward and aft shock absorbers. Non-integral day and night sights are required to utilize the Dragon.
The complete system consists of the launcher, the tracker and the missile, which is installed in the launcher during final assembly and received by the Marine Corps in a ready to fire condition. The launch tube serves as the storage and carrying case for the missile. The night tracker operates in the thermal energy range.

Inventory:
Day tracker: 1055
Night tracker: 923

Background: The first-generation Dragon, a 1000-meter system requiring 11.2 seconds flight-to-target time, was developed for the US Army and fielded in 1970. A product improvement program (PIP) was initiated by the Marine Corps in 1985 and managed by NSWC Dahlgren. The PIP, designated Dragon II, was designed to increase warhead penetration effectiveness by 85%. The Dragon II missile is actually a retrofit of warheads to the first generation missiles already in the Marine Corps inventory..

(http://i4.photobucket.com/albums/y139/skr5150/helico3.gif)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on September 11, 2006, 07:32:00
Yes it's out, i'll get mine sometime today via the downloader.




1.4 Patch  New content

    * New level: Road to Jalalabad (Conquest 16-32-64, Singleplayer, Co-op)
    * New Server Option: No Vehicles mode


1.4 Patch  Fix List
Front End:

    * Front end - Fix server browser issues with updating info
    * Front End - Multiplayer & Co-op - Players on server list can include Bots instead of human players
    * Multiplayer Internet Server maps size filter not working
    * Fixed an issue in the front end where pressing tab twice in the IP window would cause the cursor to skip to wrong box

Game Server:

    * Increased server stability
    * All levels - Co-op - Crash after reviving player without a kit- 1st attempt Server - Linux 32 Dedicated - Server crashes when trying to rotate maps in Special Forces Co-op Mode (fixed on SUSE only. Still present in Red Hat and Fedora)
    * Adjust the minimum number of players to start the round.The new values for 16, 32 and 64 players are 6, 6 and 8 respectively.
    * Re-enable unlocks on unranked servers
    * Ranked server forces unlocks i.e. have to have unlocks selected.
    * Coop - Local Server - If Server Host is kicked and banned although they do not actually get kicked, no other players may join the server after that point.
    * Fixed a dedicated server crash which was occurring when the user held "CTRL" and "SHIFT" while selecting a map
    * Fixed a crash which would occur when c4 was placed on a flag pole and the server rotated maps
    * Vehicle drop crash related bug (missing icon)
    * Co-Op bot console commands do not function on local servers.

Client / Gameplay:

    * Red/Blue nametag bug Fix to the issue where players would show up with the wrong color name tag
    * Introduced a delay from proning to standing to help reduce exploiting
    * Adjusted C4 to make throwing more difficult
    * Fixed the issue where a red distance marker appears on the ground
    * Fixed the issue that caused players arms to become invisible after switching weapons when using throwable items
    * Made adjustments to reduce the damage taken by vehicles when driving
    * Adjusted the tire material on the muscle car to reduce the issue with this vehicle taking too much damage.
    * Commander options no longer available whilst dead.
    * Fixed the issue with a spawn point showing up as selected when a player has spawned in during preview round
    * Fixed the issue that would cause infantry players to be revived with no kit.
    * Fixed several rare graphics crashes.
    * Fixed issue with players crashing while clicking "Join Game" in the front end
    * Car-Drop: Made adjustments to the car drop feature to prevent players from exploiting into buildings.
    * Discovered and repaired an issue tied to projectiles which would sometimes allow tanks to fire two shells, support to fire multiple rounds, and other issues (all maps).
    * Fixed bug where after 2 rounds on the same map, the top player stars are awarded to the wrong people in the menu
    * Transport Helicopters  Increased the armor of all transport helicopters

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Rewired on September 13, 2006, 15:23:06
Quote from: Patch 1.4 on September 11, 2006, 07:32:00
1.4 Patch  Fix List
Front End:

    * Front end - Fix server browser issues with updating info
    * Front End - Multiplayer & Co-op - Players on server list can include Bots instead of human players
    * Multiplayer Internet Server maps size filter not working
    * Fixed an issue in the front end where pressing tab twice in the IP window would cause the cursor to skip to wrong box

Game Server:

    * Increased server stability
    * All levels - Co-op - Crash after reviving player without a kit- 1st attempt Server - Linux 32 Dedicated - Server crashes when trying to rotate maps in Special Forces Co-op Mode (fixed on SUSE only. Still present in Red Hat and Fedora)
    * Adjust the minimum number of players to start the round.The new values for 16, 32 and 64 players are 6, 6 and 8 respectively.
    * Re-enable unlocks on unranked servers
    * Ranked server forces unlocks i.e. have to have unlocks selected.
    * Coop - Local Server - If Server Host is kicked and banned although they do not actually get kicked, no other players may join the server after that point.
    * Fixed a dedicated server crash which was occurring when the user held "CTRL" and "SHIFT" while selecting a map
    * Fixed a crash which would occur when c4 was placed on a flag pole and the server rotated maps
    * Vehicle drop crash related bug (missing icon)
    * Co-Op bot console commands do not function on local servers.

Client / Gameplay:

    * Red/Blue nametag bug Fix to the issue where players would show up with the wrong color name tag
    * Introduced a delay from proning to standing to help reduce exploiting
    * Adjusted C4 to make throwing more difficult
    * Fixed the issue where a red distance marker appears on the ground
    * Fixed the issue that caused players arms to become invisible after switching weapons when using throwable items
    * Made adjustments to reduce the damage taken by vehicles when driving
    * Adjusted the tire material on the muscle car to reduce the issue with this vehicle taking too much damage.
    * Commander options no longer available whilst dead.
    * Fixed the issue with a spawn point showing up as selected when a player has spawned in during preview round
    * Fixed the issue that would cause infantry players to be revived with no kit.
    * Fixed several rare graphics crashes.
    * Fixed issue with players crashing while clicking "Join Game" in the front end
    * Car-Drop: Made adjustments to the car drop feature to prevent players from exploiting into buildings.
    * Discovered and repaired an issue tied to projectiles which would sometimes allow tanks to fire two shells, support to fire multiple rounds, and other issues (all maps).
    * Fixed bug where after 2 rounds on the same map, the top player stars are awarded to the wrong people in the menu
    * Transport Helicopters  Increased the armor of all transport helicopters

I don't know about you guys, but there is just something about this that sounds familiar...

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: =XCU=madenod on October 12, 2006, 08:38:42
All support guns are light machine guns. They just have less recoil than others each other.
If your a veteran with support then you'll know that you don't need to prone when firing long range or short. It's all about the short burst for long and the rapid fire for close. G3 is an all rounder gun aswell so it can also fire long range.
PKM maybe slow to us firing it, but have you seen how fast the bullets come out from the front view by changing it with the 'C' button while firing? 8)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Gunwounds on October 18, 2006, 15:09:07
http://www.shacknews.com/extras/2006/042806_quakewars_qa_1.x

Shack: How does Enemy Territory: QUAKE Wars stand out from games in similar genres, such as the Battlefield series?

Paul Wedgwood: Both id Software and Splash Damage are fans of Battlefield (and both companies are known for running Battlefield game servers for their staff and friends), but ETQW should be thought of as a different kind of game with different development and gameplay goals. ETQW is fundamentally built with the goal of creating gameplay where teamwork makes a significant difference in whether or not you complete objectives. The game is also unique in pitting asymmetrical forces against one another; Its no longer just a choice between two similar but differently-named machine guns: the choice of whether to play Strogg or GDF is significant, the strategies are different, and the experience is different. ETQWs builds on Wolf ETs successful team play approach that has won millions of fans the world over, but is set a century after those World War II battles. It pits the Allied troops of the Global Defence Force against their most horrific threat yet - the Strogg invasion of Earth, set in the epic QUAKE universe - a conventional human military force taking on the marauding Strogg with their alien technology.


http://www.computerandvideogames.com/article.php?id=132507






(http://www.computerandvideogames.com/medialib/screens/screenshot_152807.jpg)


(http://www.computerandvideogames.com/medialib/screens/screenshot_152805.jpg)


(http://www.computerandvideogames.com/medialib/screens/screenshot_152810.jpg)


(http://www.computerandvideogames.com/medialib/screens/screenshot_152806.jpg)

According to wikipedia:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BF2142
Quote
It has recently been announced that the game will ship with Dynamic Advertising, which means changing adverts on objects such as billboards in-game. This system is featured in games such as Splinter Cell Chaos Theory, and SWAT 4.[5]

So no spyware, but still ads so that EA can continuously get revenue after you have purchased the game.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Cybopache on November 18, 2006, 14:51:09
New patch ready for download.

Things continue to move within the Battlefield Universe. Today we are releasing the 1.41 patch for Battlefield 2 that resolves an intermittent crash that affected game servers. Although this is a small update this improvement will greatly improve the stability for players. This patch will be available beginning at 4:00pm GMT.

Our support staff has begun to address the accounts of players who use exploit tactics to advance themselves. Stats acquired through the use of exploits will be removed while accounts that show extreme abuse are subject to a complete stats wipe. We will also be announcing policy changes regarding player cheating and stats exploit in the near future.

As always keep your eyes to this space for all your Battlefield Updates,

cybocommander
_________________

Quote from: gunner154 on January 03, 2007, 19:56:04

Quote from: Re-erjin999 on January 04, 2007, 03:31:34
I think it depends on the server speed at the other end a fair bit. A fast server=less time. It does take too long though.

Also have to realise that there are up to 64 players trying to connect at the same time also. I can see how that would take a little bit longer to load up. I mean considering the pings of each player, maps, graphics etc. I can remember playing Generals with a 6 plyr. map and it took forever sometimes. Also, depends alot on the servers that tolerate laggers, and those that do not...I like the ones that don't myself. They are always nice and smooth games.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on January 16, 2007, 06:49:28
It's the zip-line and grappling-hook specialist badges.

If you look on your sig stats page, click on awards. Then scroll down to badges and it's toward the bottom. Look for the ones you don't have that req. you to get them playing on SF maps. I used Warlord map to get the grappling hook badge and the zip-line badge. Just spawn at he uncap base and do it on any building 10 times, then switch to sniper and use the zip-line ten times. Trust me you will hear the drum rolls.  ;)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on January 21, 2007, 08:20:32
I also have a good tip for anyone using sniper kit, or any other for that matter. Say your next to a short wall crouched down, don't lay right next to the wall but stay about oh,3 feet away or else the enemy can ID you even if your crouched down, and know where you are to sneek up on you. Also as sniper, never get up on buildings or that damn crane, thats the first place the enemy looks when they hear the sniper rifle pop-off.

Also the sniper kit pistol is by far the best one there is, nice and quiet, and fast shooting. I also will use my claymores placed right in front of my face facing forward since the blast goes forward not everywhere, it wont hurt you at all. Then one placed behind me. and always displace after a few min. cause your never invisible.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

Hey scarman!
points at the end are not just kills, its points(by team mates)+ kills.

Cause you can`t be sure how many kills untill the drums are heard. I was just wondering.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on January 22, 2007, 05:14:36
Ok you know in game when you check out your score? and you see the skull icon then beside that there is a crosshair icon. That crosshair icon and the score under it playing as sniper are the kills you have attained from your sniper rifle.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

-= EDIT =-

You guys MUST get BFSV (stats viewer) it rocks, it shows you exactly what you need to get any medal/badge for vanilla and SF. Also counts the number of badges (so also tells you how many times you came 1st or 2nd or 3rd...etc...).

One other thing as commander, have you ever noticed when you are scanning the map you see a lot of red dots? ::)
Don`t spot them  while you can see them,  cause your batalion  won`t see them just hear you have spottet them. Wait until they are gone then go spot them(n you gotto remember app where  they were). One other thing , have you ever seen a white dot? ;D
well woala, it`s the opposite  teams Commander as you are white for him.
got it?

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on February 13, 2007, 12:06:11
As commander, when you click on an ally and see the white dots, you will see in the squads on the left that dot highlighted so you can speak directly to him or her. That is if the are all squaded up as they are suppose to be.  ;)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

I love it.  :D Running on a AMD 64 3400+ venice @2.6 mgrhz. I haven't touched the FSB for overclocking yet. Also got a asus chilly vent cooler with heatpipes. Man it's so dman quiet I actually have to look sometimes to tell if it's on. Stays at a cool 84 degrees F.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Cybopache on February 22, 2007, 05:25:51

Original by Oakenfold @ krackouse.net


In this comprehensive guide, I will cover the basics of flight, targeting, dog fighting, bombing, and how to make sure nobody ever punishes you for the inevitable accidental TKs emitted from your jet. Well, maybe minus the part about the tk punishing. Nothing short of atomic weapons will get rid of punishers. In addition to the basics, we will go over some more advanced subjects. To top it off, we will show you how to use moves(not the human-missile-in-the-mountain move you noob) to be a better pilot in Battlefield 2.

SECTION ONE: PREFLIGHT

What should I have if I want to be feared in the air?
1-Joystick. No ifs, ands, or buts about it. Joystick pilots reign.
2-Good soundcard, with headphones or good 5.1/7.1 speakers.
3-The in-game graphics setting "Effects" on high. This makes contrails much more visible.
4-A good team that will spot vehicles on the map for you.

  

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
SECTION TWO: LIFT OFF! BASIC FLIGHT

Throttle
As mentioned in Section One, a joystick is a must for being a great jet pilot. Some people may contend that they are very good with mouse/keyboard, but dont listen to them. Theyre idiots. Stop reading this guide and go by a stick.

With a keyboard, you are either at full throttle, 0% throttle, or -100% throttle. With a joystick, you can accurately set your throttle to 60%, or -30%, making your ability to maneuver and pull off trickier moves far greater than any keyboard/mouse pilot.

Throttle Hint: On all jets except the F35, full back on the throttle is not 0%. It is full reverse. To go to 0% throttle on any jet, you need to have your throttle control in the middle on your joystick. Full reverse comes in very hand when you need to slow down quickly.

On the American F35 Strike Fighter, full reverse changes the direction of the engines instead of applying full reverse throttle.

Control Surfaces
 

In a jet, constant air movement against control surfaces is essential for maneuvering. Control surfaces on jets include ailerons(bank left/right), rudder(Left/Right Yaw), and elevator(Pitch up/down).

The ailerons are typically controlled by pushing the joystick you bought before coming into section two left or right. This will control your roll, or bank. Pushing left or right on your stick will cause your plane to roll that direction, but not necessarily change heading(aka compass direction).

Elevator is your pitch up and down, typically up and down on your joystick. This changes your angle of attack, meaning the angle to which your nose is pointing up or down on the horizon. In Battlefield 2, you can now monitor your angle of attack by observing the artificial horizon bar on your HUD.

Rudder is the most overlooked and underused control surface. It controls your yaw, easily explained by this example:
Imagine a pole is shoved through the center of your plane, inserted into the top and coming out of the bottom. Rudder will essentially rotate your jet around that pole. This is why steering on the ground is done using the rudder instead of the ailerons. Rudder mastery is essential for more advanced maneuvers, and even many beginner maneuvers.

Basic Flight

While airborne in your sparkly new jet, combinations of control surface changes cause the plane to maneuver.

To turn quickly and effectively, you need to combine all the control surfaces. By banking to the left 80 degrees, pulling back on the stick 100%, and applying full to medium left rudder, your turning radius will be dramatically smaller than if you chose to apply only a single control surface. This is obviously essential for dog fighting. If you want to feel like Maverick in Top Gun(sans the F14, damn you EA), you need to practice turning quickly. Try throttling down for a moment prior to entering the turn, and then using after burner(more on this later). This will also decrease your turning radius.

Diving and climbing are as important as turning, and a foundation to the rest of the maneuvers in this guide. To a small extent, your speed is affected by your angle of attack. If youre climbing, you wont gain much speed. However if you are diving, it is important to know that you will be gaining speed.

While diving, be sure to pay close attention to your altitude. Otherwise, start practicing your l33t parachuting skillz.

Practice using heavy rudder no matter what maneuver you are trying for, and over time, your agility as a pilot will increase exponentionally because of this.
go practice and I`ll be back with more
 
end of lesson one + two 8)

point man cybo

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Cybopache on February 23, 2007, 05:23:51
Here are some more homework lads and girlz.
I really do not know what kind of  missiles they are( brand),but the manual says only heat seeking missiles.
I found out this bout the real J-10 jets:
Armament
Guns: 1× 23 mm internal cannon
Hardpoints: 11, 3 under each wing and 5 under the fuselage
Missiles:
Air-to-air: PL-8, PL-11, PL-12
Air-to-surface: PJ-9, YJ-9K, 90mm unguided rocket launcher pods
Bombs: laser-guided bombs (LT-2), glide bombs (LS-6) and unguided bombs
http://www.fas.org/man/dod-101/sys/missile/row/pl-8.htm

SECTION THREE: INTERMEDIATE FLIGHT

Aileron roll
(Note, NOT barrel roll)
 

This is rarely used on its own, but it is an essential building block for more complex maneuvers and combinations. Your plane does not change altitude much in this roll, and if it does, practice until it does not.

To Perform: Raise the nose a very small bit, and apply full ailerons in the desired direction of your roll. Compensate for any drift up or down by using your elevators.

Hint: Practice performing a number of consecutive aileron rolls, and then ending the roll while inverted. This is a valuable, fast, and sneaky way to become inverted(which will be a building block to some other more advanced maneuvers).

Barrel roll
 

This is the move everyone hears about, and nobody does right. It is a corkscrew, where your altitude will change. This is one of the most valuable maneuvers, because it seems like Battlefield 2 heat seekers dont do barrel rolls very well. This will also allow you to avoid cannon fire, and if used in conjunction with reducing throttle, you will find that the jet on your 6 oclock often is concentrating on following you with his guns instead of slowing down, and will fly right into your firing zone.

To Perform: Raise the nose about 10-20 degrees, and then bank sharply left or right. At the same time, gently pull back on the stick to maintain the roll. Usually, the stick will be toward the lower left or lower right corner of the axis for most of this roll.

Hint: Spicing it up with varied and random rudder movement will all but ensure that nothing hits your plane.

Loop Over
 

All loops are essential building blocks to more advanced piloting, but it is important that you know that there are a number of kinds of loops.

Above, you see the Loop Over, which is just a normal loop. In Battlefield 2, jets have no throttle problems in trying to get over the crest of the loop like the did in 1942. Nonetheless, it is worth practicing this seemingly simple maneuver.

While practicing it, make sure you can loop and end up heading in exactly the same direction you started. This will help you tremendously when youre working on attacking ground targets, and start learning how to loop bomb/strafe. Use your artificial horizon to monitor your roll through the loop to ensure you stay straight and end up heading in the same direction you started in.

To Perform: Throttle up, pull back on the stick. Dont crash you noob.

Loop Under
 

On the loop under, you need enough altitude to pull it off. Otherwise, it is relatively self explanatory where your plane will wind up. The only variable would be how many pieces it is in when it gets there.

Again, as with the loop over, the thing to practice on this is ending up flying in the same exact direction you started.

To Perform
Perform a half aileron roll, coming out inverted. Pull back on the stick, gaining airspeed and losing altitude. Keep your throttle up for the entire loop. Once you reach your inverted position again, perform another half aileron roll to right yourself

Use your artificial horizon to monitor your roll through the loop to ensure you stay straight and end up heading in the same direction you started in.

You now have a list of the basic and intermediate skills you should practice if youre striving to stop getting wtfpwnd every time you get in a jet. Now, lets get to some of the maneuvers that separate the nublets from the sky jockys.

cybogirl

I had been dreaming this moment for quite a while now, and what a perfect time it has come at.
Last night just before scarman came in on ts2, I was swiched over to the admin channel by boon with the notion that I had done something wrong, I felt that I some how must have interupted the beginning of thier clan training war they had.

He calmly asked me the question if I wanted to join the awsome, fun loving XCU clan and I felt nervous enough to panic as to take it into my mind if this was for real. And it was!

I couldn't beleive it, I was watching the clan battle from outside in the lobby each time it refreshes, and then hear that XCU had won both rounds,soon after I join up officially with XCU, has made it a truly fantastic night. Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on April 15, 2007, 03:56:35
Reason is the game is unbalanced in favour of vehicles when playing with vehicles. Many more people play with Anti-tank, which isnt really a bad thing as without vehicles hardly anyone plays it. The thing is, infantry-vs-infantry battle is just a lot more fun, a bunch of guys shooting at each other, not worrying about a huge tank coming around a corner, and most of all, about arty giving you a slight migrane as you move around.

Its quite subtly different in that (myself at least) you might not realise when you start prefering IO (Infantry Only) play.

Try Karkand, one of the best maps, and try IO...Most people stick to city maps as well, as it best suits IO.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: =XCU=madenod on April 16, 2007, 03:12:17
X-fire is a program exactly like msn which allows you to msn chat while you're in a game aswell.
It's the next best thing to communicating in game with your squad/freinds, but ts 2 is the ultimate one.

Download here.
http://www.xfire.com/

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Cybopache on April 16, 2007, 03:14:46
X fire is the ultimate buddy tracking program out there!! ::)
It fills 5-10 megs and when you add friends they accept(as in MSN ,SKYPE and so on).You can  see whos online and what they are playing and in what server too.You can chat with them directly in the game with out you in the game. Therer are also voice chat, and a bunch of other stuff.
check it out.
www.xfire.com
add us ,I think me,scar ,maddie,erjiin rewire are using the forun name as nick any other welcome to add their nicks.

cybo

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on April 17, 2007, 13:38:43
Currently the biggest feature is that I can hunt down scar/mud/cybogirl....anyone, simply by checking which server xfire says they are playing on. Without that I would rely on, say, scar having msn open and an automesage saying where he was or something equally silly.

Its great, and allows good in game chat text chat between xfire friends.

A good download and install to have.

They do OK with guns, and I need the extra healing points to rise from my somewhat permanent position in the middle of the score board. (As I'm used to driving armored vehicles and only run around as infantry between vehicles, it's a very big change to only play infantry.)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: sp1cy on May 15, 2007, 13:37:03
 well varicocele is varicose (enlarged or swell) vains in the vain network that drain the testicals in the spermatic cord.. so they can form somthing
 like blood baloons above the testicals.. and can be painfull and efrect
 flerity..

 lipomas are fat masses.. a tumars that are  made of fat celles(u dont have to be fat to get them)  i have 2 under my left breast...
 i was scared to death when i discoverd them suddenly..
  not knowing what kind of tumar are they..
 but when i went to the hospital they told me they are harmless
 and can be removed but i didnt accept.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on June 11, 2007, 07:17:45
Thanks Madenod. I am still soldiering on, now my K/D ratio is around 1.02 and climbing.

I have recently changed my mouse surface (I play on an old cupboard shelf placed on my desk, which allows me to extend my keyboard out more comfortably for me) and have swapped sides on it. I think this has meant my optical mouse is slightly more accurate now. Or perhaps I am now getting more used to placing the cross hairs more accurately quicker.

Either way, I find I am now kicking butt more. I think playing with XCU has honed my skills now beyond what they were before. Still more to go, a lot of room for improvement, but a good place to be right now :P.

I also find that I can predict movement of the enemy on the map better and can sort of expect where people will be. I am killing people without them seeing me more and more, coming from funny angles and stuff. The kind of thing that used to happen to me not too long ago.

I still get screwed by lots of people, its just nice to screw others in return :8.

The only thing that bothers me is that I am the ONLY darn =FD2K= tagged player on XCU !! Come on guys, I know Muds has been assimilated, but we should be able to pull together a squad of sorts. Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: =XCU=madenod on June 13, 2007, 10:53:19
I'd like to add that anyone of you who uses a support class should take advantage of the triple burst mode of the MG36 because it is equal to the G36E but the gap between each burst is slow but it is still as accurate as the G36E in long range. Porblem with the MG36 is it's to much a delicate machine gun as people get used to the slowness of the PKM and this puts them off using the burst mode at all.

If it's made for burst mode then it must be what it does otherwise it's just a plain ordinary machine gun with nothing going for it. When it says it has high strength polimers when needed it means it strengthens the front muzzle to make 3 bullets pop out in streight. The recoil is far less in this mode and it's more accurate to kill from this mode rather than doing tap tap for one shots. I've been trying this for a while and feel that now I can finally kill alot more in long range now.
Now here's a problem that support people need to overcome,remebering to switch back to full auto and vice versa.

Anyhow, if anyone can get good at this then they are on a roll of alot of kills. 8)

P.S.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: =XCU=madenod on June 14, 2007, 03:46:07
Scarmans right about pistols coz he's implying that these are used for long range/defence, Also if you run out of ammo. In which case if you have a MK3A1 then it's pistol all the way till you feel the enemy is close. You can fire far with a DOA-12 but definetly not with a MK3A1. I could'nt swap a shotgun for the engineers MP7 coz of it's humungous recoil, it may be the smallest/lightest sub machine gun but the rate of fire causes it to lift upwards in 1 second so best to always go prone and shoot at the groin and let it rake upwards to the head. If the enemy is crouching then best shoot at the feat.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on June 16, 2007, 06:45:19

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on June 16, 2007, 12:59:52
Depends on the tool. Simple print screen button click with no app/tool installed can only handle 1 pic at a time, and new one overwrites the old. It copies it to the clipboard, for you paste into anything you want (word, mspaint, photoshop...whatever you want) where proper tools can get many pictures and store then in your chosen location (they may have a default one) when you press the print screen button (you can usually change they key too).

Hope that helps.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: sp1cy on June 17, 2007, 01:55:05

 and haw to open it? am not going to use any tools. thnks

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on June 21, 2007, 00:59:13
Then if it is print screen by defualt it will go to your clipboard (memory) and from there you can normally paste it to any program that can handle pics (word, mspaint, not notepad...etc...).

Try it, it it does paste to word or something then you can only store one pic at a time, which is crap. If that is the case, upgrade to some other program. I would still recommend howies screen capture (google if you want it).

Scar ? You still not online ?

DICE made BF2. EA sell it. EA thought of ways to screw customers (as they seem to do with every game they release). They decided to get gamespy to host the stats servers (everyone knows how stats heavy BF2 is). They must've thought the bugs were bad enough, and if not, something bad will turn up, it always does.

Well, no gamespy don't seem to be accepting stats. Some have said it is probably because ea don't want to pay them. EA are farts.

BF2412 works ok on stats because I have heard that they are themselves hosting the stats servers.

People are becoming paranoid that they will lose their stats. I dont think that will happen. I think that if anything they will never be updated (damn !!) which is bad enough. Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on June 24, 2007, 05:05:03
This was my reply from EA about the stats being down via email:

"EA Customer Support is currently aware of a stat outage which is affecting several players. We are working extremely hard to pinpoint the cause of the issue and correct it. EA|Dice, EA Customer Support and all the Battlefield Partners are dedicated to making sure that your game play experience remains exciting and that your hard work is recorded while playing Battlefield.

While every effort will be made to include stats gained during the outage, there is a possibility that those earned during this brief period will not be reflected in your final stats total. We appreciate your patience and understanding, and apologize for the inconvenience.

Update: As of 6-22-07 we are still working on this issue and appreciate your continued patience. We will update this FAQ again as soon as we have additional information."

"If you wish to receive a notification of any changes or updates on this issue please click the Notify me.. button at the bottom of this page."

I was going to use xfire to find out the server IP for antik, that's why it took me so long to join, becuase you closed xfire while playing, when I said "ok, Ill join you" (probably for cpu usage reasons). I had to google antik, and wasn't sure I had the right one, as I think there is more then 1 antik server.

Anyway, I found you and joined and played. First off, I lagged quite badly at some points, often enough. I dont think it was my ping at all, it was probably my graphics. I will definitely turn them down a bit and play with you again.

You must've noticed quite a few times I jumped out of the driving seat and let you drive as I don't know my way around the map well at all, only played it a few times (10-20) loooong time ago.

The players were normal/average. The pilots were good, but there are just as good on the ranked servers. The last time you killed me in the helicopter I was looking on the team list to see where you were, I couldn't see you (now I know it was because you were shooting at the chopper I was a passenger in! :)).

I was not sure you could hear me on Comms, I thought you must have it off, as you made no reply, not even in text. It did feel weird playing in a vehicle server on that map, because I tend to stick to city maps even with/without vehicles.

Overall - good fun and would love to play with you again (on BF2 !! naughty people !).

Keep xfire running in the background, its not too bad and then we know when you are on and can join you.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on June 30, 2007, 02:08:33
I find medic easier to play with and last long with as I can heal myself. So if I go 1vs1 or 1vs2 or whatever I can heal myself after if I get any damage, which increases my chances of survival. I know of people who run around with assault or whatever and just kill people one after another with no need of medic, as they are so quick.

I cant rely on that so medic it is for me, but I do play other kits pretty equally.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2

Bad thing is the enemy knows where you are to finish you off coz of the bug using bags. Anyone on either team can see a medics back through buildings once they are being dropped.

I keeps seeing people dropping all 3 med packs on the floor, when it only takes one pack to heal, and then I just leep around the corner and cream him/her with bullets.
