Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on July 03, 2007, 04:31:00
Congratulations scar! Spicy, he is talking about joining the clan =XCU=, with Madenod has joined and so have I.

Its nice and fun.

I still want to play again with you spicy, just to see what you mean about those guns, and maybe show you how good the 3 burst medic unlock is (I am trying not to use it because it is making it hard for me to use other kits, I get used to it too much. In clan battles unlocks are not allowed generally, so I need to practice with other guns!!).

The G3 is the gun I get out when I get angry. It has extreme power, takes out fools (when I am angry they are "fools" and not fellow game players :P) in a efw shots, if that. It is reasonably accurate, and when I am angry I dont mind it running out of bullets, as it usually means I have killed 2 people with the round.

Having said that, it DOES have a small round, another 5 bullets would have been excellent, but probably overpowerful too, so I think it works ok.

I dont use it for general fighting though, I like to kill 3 or more people quickly and I dont think it is good for that. Maybe if I use single shot...

Scar, I havent gone back yet, maybe when we hit page 100 I might !  ;) ;)

I do worry about my stats, I want them to be good, its another side of the game for me, its about killing, not being killed, and then seeing how you compare to those around you. I am trying to get my K/D to 1.5 and get my Score Per Minute/SPM up to as close to 3 as possible.

At my current rate I am probably achieving that, but I need to make up for the times when I was a complete beginner and lost big time.

Generally I tend to score in the top half of the scoreboard, and often get medals (gold , silvers and bronze). I like medals :P

Quote from: sp1cy on July 14, 2007, 06:39:19
playing inf only make u a lamer..
Explain why that is please.  ::)

My complaint had nothing to do with skill, or how to shoot a hele down, I didn't get the game yeterday, i'm aware of what vehicles, armour and hele's do. That wasen't the problem I had with that server,it was the baseraping and spawn-killing that pissed me off, plain and simple.

The good thing about playing with the official rankings and such is, when such a thing starts happening I can move to a different server and don't have to deal with it. Instead of being stuck only in one server.  ;) We do play in other games and servers with all units all the time. That's just how the Clan battles and other matches are geared. And anyone who has played in or with XCU cannot say it didn't sharpen their skill's, even if it was a few games. Hell, to even play against all of the other clanmates you have no choice but to get sharper skills...or you are usually dead pretty quick.

 and armored juggernaut ,,, u will panic every time u hear the jet passing by..

 and aa rockets its normal that you will get smacked ..
 because all you know is haw to deal with inf by shooting them all the time and the inf never
 do as much damage  as trained pilots and good armor unites..
 now if you playe on inf servers all the time you wont have the sense
 of danger that keeps you from getting hit all the time, the player who playes
 on normal servers is in more danger than you. and is more skilled in the game than
 you.and have more aggression than you. yes you get  better skilles in inf war but on the account of losing other skilles
such as hiding and surface to air attacks,
  that's means inf players=lamers . because they will get pounded at the real servers and will
never be good pilots or armor units
 as for spawn killing its Oslo your fault because you are used to playe on lam servers..

 kill you because they are meters awy from the flag and on 64/64 servers you wont believe
 have fast the  waves of attackers are , on maps like sharki or road to jalal. man they are not spawn killers they are just moving lines after lines so its normal that u get killed
and here you have 2 choices : 1_ spawn at base and find a transport (that what i do)
2_ get into a squad and then you spawn at the flag.
_about base rape we have scripts against base rapers and the ban list is full of them but
new players are allways coming in at antik and they don't usually read the rules
and they get kicked all the time because when you do that the server will give you
warnings in green text calling you by name then it will kick and ban you,
antik is not the best server when it comes to rules but its normal to have issues like this
in a 64/64 players server that is full all the time..
about you having the choice of diffrent servers i never said that getting the copy of the game
is better than the cool ea ranking but it was all the choices i had.. but at the end i got used to the
players at antik they are much similar to the dune2k community were you get known by others
and have a chance to make nice Friends. so its not a total loss..

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: sp1cy on July 21, 2007, 17:19:35

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: =XCU=madenod on July 22, 2007, 03:55:50
I have been playing as spec-ops for the 4th week and had been rewarded the veteran combat badge 3 times already and game spy simply will not reward it to me. I will still be spec-ops until it does get recorded and that will mean more deaths in the struggle for this veteran badge.

Now from my exp of the weapons for spec-ops. The G36C is so accurate you can lie on the floor and kill someone in full auto in medium or and in some cases long(provided you can shoot a moving target smoothly >:( ;D)

Scar-L has almost no recoil when standing so you can walk sideways and shoot someone who is lying down or shoot someone from medium by standing.

My choice of gun is the Scar-L as it has the laser dot and you can shoot someone accurately while standing up. I have tested the cross hair pattern from standing,crouching and going prone and it all is the same pattern for Scar-L in any position. 8)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on July 22, 2007, 08:24:52
Quote from: =XCU=madenod on July 22, 2007, 03:55:50
My choice of gun is the Scar-L as it has the laser dot and you can shoot someone accurately while standing up. I have tested the cross hair pattern from standing,crouching and going prone and it all is the same pattern for Scar-L in any position. 8)
Oh hell yea, I love the Scar-L. Takes about 3 to 5 shots to the body(depending on what kit they are) and 2 to the face for kill,but like Mad said hardly no recoil at all. What I wish EA would do is make the ones in SF unlocks because it is the heavy version Scar-L.Reg BF2 has only the light version. Aim for the face on semi an that thing rocks.

adj., dank·er, dank·est.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on August 01, 2007, 06:31:32
Xfire  ;) tells me your on what ip and game your in etc. The one I jumped in on was on Mashtuur 64 plyr. and yes it was crazy. I was on your side but no squad. But i'm telling ya man, TS not the in game VOIP  rules and makes the game 100x better. Nothing beats hearing someone lose their cool in game...i'm guilty of that sometimes as well. Xfire I only use really to find someone, or get an IP for a game they are in. And the reason for that is, when I stop to chat in game, 99% of the time I will die. So chatting is a no-can-do for me. The prob with pub. servers and the in game VOIP is you tend to get these ass-hats that talk about their girl friends, and smoking doobies and they are usually your squad leader or commander. So I stopped using that alltogether...TS all the way man.

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Re-erjin999 on August 01, 2007, 08:44:19
Well speaking to someone from XCU about button setup and stuff, I mapped TS chat to my middle scroll wheel on my mouse, and left in game VoIP on button "B" (something I didnt do before, and it was murder at times). Now I can use both in game chat and TS, and its a mix of both that works best.

In game chat when you want to tell boon that he is being followed, or where to go, and TS to gloat that you just killed madenod!

Man, playing in a squad you split your points up with the sqaud (like this: you come across an enemy with your squad of 3-4, chances are you dont take him out, someone else does, you find him alone, your job is to take him out..or you're dead. Well, we dont die, we kill. So you get every kill if you are alone, and only some kills if you are in a squad).

You can still medicate if you are in a squad. By being in a squad, I mean actually stick with them, not just have players with green name tags on opposite ends of the map!

So I usually only score high when I go solo and go to the front lines like Rambo with some bandages in my backpack ;)

A random shockpaddle after killing his friend. Felt good as the guy was troubling my teammate so its nice to come from behind and take someone out so your firends can proceed...

(http://img394.imageshack.us/img394/4720/screen026oj0.th.jpg) (http://img394.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen026oj0.jpg)
The most recent clan game. Too them both out with one shot. Quite proud as I cannot really use the noobtube properly!

(http://img394.imageshack.us/img394/8039/screen028xl5.th.jpg) (http://img394.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen028xl5.jpg)
Shickpaddled his ass after he killed me seconds earlier. The special bit is it was a clan game and you should never do that in an important game like that.

(http://img62.imageshack.us/img62/9240/screen029kr7.th.jpg) (http://img62.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen029kr7.jpg)
A nice Kill/Death ratio and on my way to a nice score! Notice the difference to the closest player?

(http://img250.imageshack.us/img250/8421/screen031bl0.th.jpg) (http://img250.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen031bl0.jpg)
Turns out to be a quite decent score in the end and a healthy addition to my Kill to Death ratio!

(http://img62.imageshack.us/img62/2971/screen030yn0.th.jpg) (http://img62.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen030yn0.jpg)
Again, troubling my team mates so I took him out from behind, deliberately going around the building.

(http://img408.imageshack.us/img408/1451/screen034tp1.th.jpg) (http://img408.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen034tp1.jpg)
3 Kills in a row using my medic gun, the one spicy says isnt too good. We on 3 burst I have taken out 3 men so far using just 1 and a bit clips.

(http://img408.imageshack.us/img408/7317/screen035zw8.th.jpg) (http://img408.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen035zw8.jpg)
And now their buddy wants to go to hell with them, so I helped him get there with my trusty G36E. So in total less then 2 clips used, and a great result :)

(http://img502.imageshack.us/img502/5120/screen036gv8.th.jpg) (http://img502.imageshack.us/my.php?image=screen036gv8.jpg)
Just another guy hiding like a coward who met an electrifying end ;)

Title: Re: Battlefield 2
Post by: Scar5150 on November 02, 2007, 08:33:19
Holy sh*t!!  this video card kicks all sorts of ass. For the first time ever I can play BF2 on all high setts, for hours without a hickup. I cannot get over how great it looks now, just frickin amazing. Again it's this one http://www.newegg.com/product/product.asp?item=N82E16814130062
 It has 24/7 free tech support with it, even if you call them at 3 a.m. they help you. I priced it at Nvidia for around $190.00 I bought this from good ole Newegg.com for 89 with a 15 buck rebabte I will basically get a 15 dollar check in the mial from Newegg. I know the 8800 series are greater, but this damn thing is no slouch at all...I cannot stress enough how good this card is. Best bang for the buck I have ever come across yet in cards. And the way I played BF2 on all high setts was using the high quality setting not the high performance one. AL I can say is it's a steal for $89.00. take a good look at those picks of it on that link. Toms Hardware highly recommended it also. Also has SLi ready so when I get a duel card board i'm gettting another one of these. Sorry if this should be in the hardware thread but I just had to tell how it played intense graghic games so damn good.

I'll be playing online pretty damn soon.

System Requirements

OS: Windows Vista/7
Processor: Any Quadcore Processor
Memory: 2 GB
Hard Drive: 15 GB for Digital Version, 10 GB for Disc Version
Video Memory: 512 MB (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 260)
Sound Card: DirectX Compatible
DirectX: 10
Keyboard and Mouse
DVD Rom Drive

 and go dx11  as long as the pc would support it .

 a good core 2 duo .

 if you can buy one now go for it .

 under 60 fps no matter haw intensive the graphics  got
